website_summaries.verdict: The best budget digital camera in Panasonic's line for casual shooting and selfies.
pros: Flip-up LCD panel can rotate 180 degrees for accurate selfie shots
Built-in Wi-Fi connection makes it easy to upload photos
Electronic viewfinder with eye-sensor allows for easier viewing outdoors
cons: Built-in flash is underpowered and awkwardly placed

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Totally Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: The camera seems to be working fine and is what I expected. However, I have repeatedly tried to register the camera online for the advertised extended warranty period. The automated response says that Panasonic will confirm my registration by email. That was 6 weeks ago - no email, no response. I tried repeatedly via email and online chat to find out what was going on with the registration. Nothing! No one will give a straight answer; no one will confirm registration; everyone says to email or online chat with someone else. Pure runaround. Panasonic support is the worst I have ever encountered for photography and/or electronic equipment - and that's saying a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. White

customer_reviews.title: I liked the camera just fine
customer_reviews.text: I liked the camera just fine, except it quit working after 6 months. When I contacted customer service they refused to honor the warranty, claiming we abused the camera. We used the camera, a lot, but did not abuse it. Customer service was extremely difficult to talk too, taking 4 days to return my call they claimed would be returned in 1-2 days. When they did call it was 5 minutes before the office closed for the day, and making it again impossible to talk to a person. I strongly suggest not buying anything from Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Hotra

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it but... better photos from my Samsung phone!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it less than 1.5 hours, awful quality of photos kind of fuzzy even up close; and too dark, even with ISO/white balance/HDR/Scene selection. I was able to connect to WiFi and image app easily to send photos to my phone... I seen that was a problem for people in reviews here. I wanted to like this camera, but it's still not better than my Samsung phone.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: stopped charging 5 days after the return window closed.
customer_reviews.text: the camera stopped charging 5 days after the return window closed.....
customer_reviews.author: Emily's mom

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, not for me anymore
customer_reviews.text: The sad thing is...this entire series was the best hand held small camera available. It had lots of features but the Leica lens was it's crowning jewel..the best in the business. Sadly, this camera is not it's predecessor. It is cheaply made to almost an extreme. I bought it but returned it. If you use your camera like mine, a little work horse, this cheap plastic, almost crudely put together camera is not for you. I sure wish they'd go back to the sleek, well built design of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Jaci  Muzamel

customer_reviews.title: Good compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this advanced point & shoot. I've had a Canon DSLR (now about 8 years old) and the auto photos with this camera are better. I have not explored all the advanced features. The only thing I would caution, is to note that the articulating screen is for taking selfies, not really helpful if you are looking for an angled screen for taking photos above a crowd, for instance. I spent a lot of time reading online reviews for this and other cameras and would recommend the same for anyone buying this camera. I take photos primarily on vacation and for eBay and find this much more convenient than my DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Camera fell apart
customer_reviews.text: The camera took good pictures for awhile. Then I was hard to turn on. shortly after the off/on function stopped working and the zoom won't come out. The battery cover continued to fall off. We have had the camera under a year. Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Replaced an older model of the same Panasonic. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older model of the same Panasonic. I have a much more expensive DSLR with expensive lenses but this gives virtually the same image quality except in low light conditions. Much less of a hassle to take along this small camera than the big DSLR. We end up using this 75% of the time rather than hauling around the big camera with all the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: RobM

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Very impressive picture quality. My favorite feature is the 30X zoom. It is comparable to 10X binoculars in magnification when set to 30X zoom (because the camera starts off at wide angle, it takes 30X to equal 10X). With the eye piece viewfinder, you can use it like binoculars. (or monocular to be technically correct) Great battery life. Easily fits in a standard pocket. Nice selection of shooting modes. 4.5 x 2.5 x 1.5 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanical Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the shirt pocket size, zoom, autofocus and stabilization for taking quick travel photos. Don't like the non-intuitive, clumsy, difficult GPS geotagging through the cell phone app instead of being built into the camera. It is really difficult to remember to start the app and geo-logging before a day of picture taking and then remembering to stop the geo-logging at the end of the day. The transfer of the data from the phone to the camera is difficult and easy to forget. Liked the built-in geotagging of previous Lumix models. The large battery has a good life but you should buy a spare.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Gave this to my wife for Christmas and it replaced an older TZ-4 model Panasonic (she loved it for a long time)
customer_reviews.text: The image quality from this camera is incredible! Gave this to my wife for Christmas and it replaced an older TZ-4 model Panasonic (she loved it for a long time). The ZS70S is a real step up. Beautiful photos. Pros: Easy to use Small footprint Excellent photo quality Quite a few settings Con: If you can call it a con, there is a learning curve to all the new features of this camera. Worth the time and effort
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very nice point-and-shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: We're very pleased with the quality of the pictures taken by this camera... it's a great option to have when we don't want to carry our heavy-duty SLR, yet we don't want to take "cell phone quality" pictures (yes, we have iPhones, and this camera beats them any day). We're happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael E. Caicedo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Travel/Hiking camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for travel and hiking! The first ultra-zoom camera I've found that collapses into a true shirt-pocket size. Granted, the pics aren't up to interchangeable SLR standards, but I'll take a slight degradation in quality for the convenience of use. I can always carry the bigger camera for special events/places...Camera is very easy to use, menus are straightforward, and the EVF is a wonderful feature when you are taking pictures outdoors on bright days. And as several reviews have noted, holding the viewfinder to your face gives an additional steadying effect when using long zoom ranges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great General Use Digital Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Panasonic Lumix camera -my first was my favorite until this one came along! The camera feels very solid and well-made. The Leica lens is the main reason I have bought 3 (the first went swimming while fishing, the second went to my son). The zoom levels and the list of features are amazing. I have been shooting landscapes in wide open deserts, detail shots of trees and lots of insects and reptiles. I found great info from users on-line to help me override the default settings and get better shots. This is a far better camera than the price suggests! But read the pro photographer reviews, THEN buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Draw4Luv

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, it’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of difficult to use. And I don’t think the picture is that great. I did a whole pro / con list with 2 other cameras (canon) and I regret not getting one of the others. My husband seems to think this camera is fine and pics are great but I think the photo quality is not good. - I’m a photographer (Nikon) and maybe I’m particular because I shoot DSLR? So that could just be why I don’t LOVE it. I do like the size, functions, shoots in RAW, and the LED viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: Alex & Jacki

customer_reviews.title: flash is in a horrible postion
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to replace a previous model that I broke but absolutely loved. On this model they moved the flash and I thought the reviewers were silly until I bought it myself and tried it - I am a middle aged person and my hands could not hold this camera comfortably without blocking some of that front flash! sent it back and I'm still in search of a replacement. My previous Panasonic Luminix took the best pictures and was so easy to transport anywhere. I took it to Europe and left my Cannon Rebel home and never regretted it. The quality and zoom were awesome but this model just did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a quality camera to complement my heavy Canon EOS 7 with telephoto. This filled the bill nicely by providing quality photos with a relatively light weight. The camera is pretty much automatic. A full manual mode would be nice. The 4K functions are great. I have selected individual images that are amazing from the 4K shots. I read many reviews before selecting the camera and it has performed as well as reviews claimed. Be prepared to study the manual to fully utilize the many functions.
customer_reviews.author: JerryW

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to camera series for travel - my fifth Lumix over the years. As with the rest, a great camera for traveling lite. Camera is small enough to fit in your pocket yet can take excellent 30x photos. I would rate the camera 5 stars, except for fact that the instruction booklets (hard copy for basic and online for advanced) are horrible (that is being kind; children might read this!)
customer_reviews.author: J. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Did not like the controls
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the settings on this camera. Every time i would get it adjusted to what i wanted to take a shot it would change on its own to a different setting. Maybe it was my problem but i do not have that problem with my other cameras. I returned and bought a differ brand that stays on the setting i pick.
customer_reviews.author: G. F. T.

customer_reviews.title: Too many features
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed a ZS 50 for years until stolen so I wanted to replace it . The ZS 70 has both a viewfinder( which I find essential here in FL) and a touch screen. Unfortunately I cannot use both as my nose touches the screen when using the viewfinder and throws the camera into streams of menus that take minutes to disable. Also, most auto functions use multi focus points, but rarely select the center, where most of my attention usually lies. Many of the features are gimmicks and require work arounds, but the camera takes great photos when I get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Steffey

customer_reviews.title: Super camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! The zoom lens is much better than I expected. I found it easy to use. Having wifi to transfer photos is great as well. I also really like being able to use a viewfinder when it is sunny and glaring on the screen. Plus it fits in a pocket!
customer_reviews.author: L. Russell

customer_reviews.title: A Big Letdown! Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic ZS80 is not even close to Nikon D5000 I bought over a decade ago. Everything I shoot with ZS80 in a well-lit room is grainy. Whether the subject is a person or an object, it's all grainy. Even if I use flash I can't get a sharp image. Outdoor shots are not sharp in a sunny day, either. iHDR is mediocre at best. Raw format is lossy and too lossy. I can't even remove the graininess in post processing. Most people won't notice the graininess/pixelation/noise because they are viewing the pictures at 50% of original size on 15" laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Pan

customer_reviews.title: An excellent sophisticated camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes fantastic photos even on automatic. Bright colors, distinct shading, contrasts, all done without much help from u. However, I found this model to be cumbersome and heavy. Perhaps due to the selfie flip front display. I also found it to be much too complicated for me to learn all of its features. So I returned it ... or u might say exchanged it for the Lumix Point and Shoot SZ60 an older model, with a few less perks but is a bit smaller and much lighter in weight and easier for me to handle. I recommend Lumix above other brands.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: We're going to Yellowstone soon and I wanted something more than my cell phone, but not my big old DSLR. I purchased the ZS100, but before I used it this went on sale for $250. Great camera for the price. The rubber grip makes a big difference too. Zoom is the key feature. The moon picture is obvious, that hotel was 7 miles away. It has way more features than you will ever use. The companion app not that useful, but it's free. It's solid, a tad heavy, but for the price and abilities just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: awraynor

customer_reviews.title: I don't deserve it!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe what a nice camera this is and all the bells and whistles included. It works just fine as a point and shoot but is inspiring me to take a class in digital photography to take full advantage of the manual operations. I realize now if you aren't focused so much on having a really small camera, you can get so many more features for the same investment. That doesn't mean the camera is huge, it just isn't its claim to fame. Really happy with the camera. It's way better than I am but I hope to be a better person for it. :)
customer_reviews.author: SummerGirl

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine except it records in avchd but won't transfer the files and no PC recognizes them so I have to use mp4. Check for film on the lens itself when on. The control ring, 4K, ZOOM, flip screen are super great. Otherwise this is an amazing camera, very handy and great features for such a small compact digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Not as represented
customer_reviews.text: This camera is packed with features but the manual that comes with it is not clearly written and does not provide good information on how to use all the features. It seems to be written for someone who knows all the terms and functions and just needs minimal direction. If you are not such a person this camera is frustrating to state taking photos with, viewing them, or saving then to a computer. This is not a camera for a novice or someone who wants a camera easy to use with intuitive features as it was represented in the advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nasky

customer_reviews.title: My Third Generation
customer_reviews.text: This is my third generation of this camera. It can do way more than I have learned to do! I keep buying it because it will fit in my pocket and it has a viewfinder. Pretty good zoom too! I am pretty rough on my cameras (always in my pocket in out of the way places) so don't be turned off that this is my third!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Zoom on Safari!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Panasonic Lumix camera. They are great for travel because of the exceptional zoom capabilities. I’m a point and shoot photographer with no skills ;) so I need an automatic focus. This camera worked great on my African safari! I used my iPhone camera, too, but this could not be beat for zoom photos. I agree with other reviewers about the camera housing seeming “cheap,” but the photo quality is fantastic for this amateur photographer.
customer_reviews.author: K.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures and Easy to Carry
customer_reviews.text: I have a bigger Panasonic camera and took it to Alaska and it was took bulky for me to carry. This camera is perfect. So easy to carry but what's better...it takes just as great pictures as my DSLR camera. I am so happy with this camera, the zoom is amazing and the closeups I get are outstanding. It's fast, quick and so easy. This camera will be perfect for my trip to Ireland. I LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great and versatile little camera
customer_reviews.text: I got the camera to take on a European trip. It turned into a whirlwind and having a small camera was just the ticket. The photos are fabulous and we're looking forward to more trips with the camera
customer_reviews.author: MartyHeyman

customer_reviews.title: Good photos, slightly clunky design
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the second time; the optional zoom is ideal for what my company is it for (building inspections). For since reason, this one didn't include a carrying case, which was a little bit of a bummer since then I had to go out and buy one. This is slightly awkward to hold comparated to earlier panasonic models as holding it with one hand blocks the flash, so indoor photos have to be taken down two hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jared James

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I got the zs70k, picture were good but videos was awful. I took a video in the sun light and everybody looked orange it was terrible and it’s true the camera struggle in low light because of the sensor size, with videos and photo. Aperture not is not good and it wont Focus in low light while filming a video. I will pay a little more and get something with a bigger sensor and better low light performance
customer_reviews.author: Jackoutofthebox

customer_reviews.title: Does not include required SD card
customer_reviews.text: This camera does not have internal memory. You can't take a picture without an SD card to store it on. That is not mentioned anywhere in the literature. The setup process in the manual even indicates an SD card is optional. Very disappointed, why sell a $450 camera package that can't take pictures?
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: A very very good snapshot camera
customer_reviews.text: Olympus and Panasonic micro 4/3 cameras are what I use for slow & careful work at high magnification, and this ZS70 for snapshots. My old snapshot camera was a Canon PowerShot A590; the ZS70 has better specs in every way, but the big feature I bought it for was focus stacking; it does that, but cuts the resolution down a lot, and the camera is still suitable only for snapshots. Money well spent, if that's your goal.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They didn't do the tech side very well.
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is wonderful, but the lack of a USB out to connect directly to a computer is dimwitted and connecting across WIFI is cumbersome and often fails. The company does hardware so well they should have just left a hardware connection solution on board because their software is poor to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bowron

customer_reviews.title: Great for daytime or flash photography, but performs poorly in low-light situations
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera for a trip where I thought it would be my primary method of taking pics, but I quickly found that any remotely low-light situation required a flash which I really didn’t want to do. All my low-light shots came out blurry, which was a huge bummer to realize only after leaving the temples where I was relying on this camera for all my pics. I may need to go a bit more high-end on the point and shoot spectrum to get the results I am looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth P

customer_reviews.title: lots of features, great images, very complicated.
customer_reviews.text: The camera has lots of features, takes great images, and is very complicated. To get the most out of it you will have to download the advanced feature manual from Panasonic's website and be prepared to spend a while studying it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Garren

customer_reviews.title: Stabilized, long zoom range, excellent lenses - good in every aspect.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My hands shake enough that the previous. Version of the LUMIX camera couldn’t get sharp images. The this camera stabilization works much better. Zoom range is great, color capture is good - superior camera in every way
customer_reviews.author: MEB Haskell

customer_reviews.title: Fully loaded, Amateur to Seasoned Photographer.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is really powerful in performance and features. Not only can it used for outstanding Macro pictures but it also does, Stop motion as well as time lapse photography. The 30x zoom is incredible although a little noisy when filming and using the zoom. Do not rely upon Panasonic's supplied manual nor the online manual, instead invest in a good book tailored specifically to this camera and you will see the sophisticated yet used friedly complexity of the ZS70k.
customer_reviews.author: Brad wright

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile camera, but not all is intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: Good camera that can do so many things. Not all are intuitive. I have had Panasonic cameras before and loved them. Needs a more complete manual. I had to buy a book to understand everything. Great quality image. A little slow to take exposure after shutter button pushed
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Takes great picture
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for two weeks and love it. I like the 30X zoom, and the multiple shot capability, the smallish size and most of all the great pictures I get. This is a much better camera than I am a photographer, but it makes me seem better than I am. There are things I don't care for. It can be hard to focus. It could fit better in your hand. But at the price I don't see how you could get a better camera.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic offers a phony extended warranty
customer_reviews.text: The camera is ok, not wonderful, It offers almost too many options and features for casual photo taking. My problem is with the Lumix Triple Warranty offered with the camera. I sent in the information requested for the extended warranty on 3/4/ 19. I received an email requesting more information. After sending what was asked for, I never received a follow up reply. Months went by and I finally contacted the customer service number that was written on the original rejection. The representative said that customer service does not deal with warranties. I have lost my trust in Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Seelig

customer_reviews.title: I have had better Panasonic's
customer_reviews.text: I love Panasonic camera's, this one however is the first time I have been disappointed. Sometimes when you zoom (could be a full zoom) it freezes, you loose the photo and you must pop the battery out and put it back in to get it to work again. For the price this simply should not happen. My older Panasonic also had crisper photo's. I still like it but the lens should not freeze in the out position.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Kang

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect Travel Cam
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size and features for a constant carry travel camera. Good quality pics but built in GPS giving you a bit more metadata would have made this the perfect travel camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Shooting RAW and multi 4 K modes
customer_reviews.text: I found this to a good addition to my liking of compact cameras. I use it over my bigger SLR when traveling or just arround the house. it has amazing feature that take practise to master. But i like the ability to has access to the RAW files.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Sun

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot 4K camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, good quality picture and the 4K video is stunning. The downside is that it record at 30fps, but the 1080p at 60fps is good enough to slow down the cinematic like videos. I love it very much, plus the 30X time zoom 24 to 700 is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Blc

customer_reviews.title: WiFi feature awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a trip to Europe. It was great! I loved the WiFi on it to be able to upload my pics quickly to my phone then add them on social media and send them to family members. If you don’t want a huge camera I would recommend this one. It was easy to put in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I am a amateur nature/landscape photographer and I have to say this camera is made for my skill level. The viewfinder is tiny but effective and I love that it has a horizon line leveling option so I can make sure my photos are not tilted. The zoom is spectacular for the price and this camera does surprisingly well in low light (great sunrise and sunset quality!). I also love its size, it's great to take on hikes to more secluded locations. Overall my expectations were surpassed with this great little camera. Happy shooting!
customer_reviews.author: onu_mpm

customer_reviews.title: What a camera!
customer_reviews.text: I scored big with my husband when I purchased this camera for him to carrying around to take pictures. He brags on what a great camera I picked out for him. He has big cameras but he wanted something lightweight to carry around the farm. He thinks it takes as good a picture as his big cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: One of the best point and shoots on the market
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of researching before buying this camera and it paid off. It's a little delicate but its reliable for low light, close-up macro & high zoom with amazing image stabilization. I've had it for 2 months now taking over 1000 photos/week (work purposes) and would highly reccomend it. 5/5...for a point and shoot camara its really an amazing camera and I have barelytouched on it's full capabilities. Bravo Panasonic!
customer_reviews.author: JayX028

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the compact size!
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact camera that has it all. The 30 X Leica lens is superior to anything on the market. Don't let the size fool you. It is packed with features only found in full size cameras costing and weighing much more. You will be blown away with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Wow wow wow...
customer_reviews.text: Man, I have a FZ1000 and other than at night, this camera is better, zoom farther, easier to use, fits in my pants. This is a bargain for $350. Honestly this would easily be a $800 camera .
customer_reviews.author: Tom Zhang

customer_reviews.title: A fairly average pocket size camera that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Good focal length range for a small size camera and the zoom comes handy.. not the best sensor ( 1/2 inch MOS sensor) or image quality but is good for the price. A handy pocket size point and shoot camera. Not for the pros but good for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Meet

customer_reviews.title: Quick and thoroughly excellent point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a point and shoot type camera that performs almost at the level of SLR style cameras. There are lots of auto focus and expressive choices as well as very good manual controls. The image quality was superb even with editing and cropping. Highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: R. Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with view finder
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this camera. I was looking for a point and shoot with a view finder since I have difficulty seeing the LCD in sunlight. They are not easy to find. After a bit of research, this Panasonic rose to the surface. The zoom is great and 20 megapixels fit the bill. I've already got some great photos with the zoom, easy to hold still enough and get crisp, clear pictures. I've only barely begun to explore the features of this camera...using only the automatic settings so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: Great photos!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a replacement for the LUMIX DC-ZS60, which I dropped and broke. I loved that camera...great photos, shoots in raw, long zoom with good quality. I expect this one to be equally good, if not better. Although it has a 30 zoom instead of 40, it has some added features which should enhance my photos. Although a bit heavier than the previous model, it is still a great camera for taking on trips...I just pop it in my purse. Another plus...it uses the same case and battery of the previous one, so I was good to go as soon as I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kautz

customer_reviews.title: Camera stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: My LUMIX stopped working. The camera stopped focusing when using the zoom feature.
customer_reviews.author: Robot

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery, and like the camera so far
customer_reviews.text: This model was a new release and they were one of the first to have it in stock. Delivery was quick and accurate. I haven’t used the camera much yet, but will be over the next 3 weeks on a trip to Scotland and Northern Ireland. I will update after the trip as it will get a lot of use I’m sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Y.

customer_reviews.title: I needed something better than my cell phone but am not willing to ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera works very well for me thus far. I needed something better than my cell phone but am not willing to carry my big DSLR around anymore. Will be using this camera on a trip soon to see what it can really do.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one camera, with a lot of potential.
customer_reviews.text: I still have a great deal to learn about using this camera effectively. However, I was able to learn enough in the few days before my vacation to give me many great photos of an unforgettable landscape.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi D

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to taking your bulky DSLR gear.
customer_reviews.text: A great alternative to taking your bulky DSLR gear. Perfect for travel. It will not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: This camera will not work for HDMI output needs.
customer_reviews.text: It won't work for streaming video using HDMI out. If you plug in the HDMI cable the camera will only output through HDMI in playback mode. The lens shutters and stowes as if it is off. The pictures are beautiful, the features are abundant for a point and shoot camera. It also has incredible 4K video that you can record on SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Perea

customer_reviews.title: Great overall camera!
customer_reviews.text: Have been purchasing the Lumix line of point-and-shoot cameras for almost 15 years. Like the convenience and ease of use. Designed for the novice or up to amateur photographer. Have had a total of at least 4 of the cameras over the years. However, there appears to be some kind of flaw in that two of the cameras developed 'spots' on the lens that were internal and could not be removed. Had no choice but to purchase a new camera as it was out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: DOUG
